qas.question: In what Orthagraphy does Modern Estonian orthography have its basis?
Who is responsible for the creation of the Newer Orthography?
In what century was the Newer Orthography created?
Previous to the Newer Orthography what orthography was in place?
From what other country's orthography did the Older Orthography get its basis?
In what Orthagraphy does Modern Estonian orthography reject?
When did German orthography stop being influential?

context: Modern Estonian orthography is based on the <a0_0><b5_0>Newer Orthography<b5_0/><a0_0/> created by <a1_0>Eduard Ahrens<a1_0/> in the second half of the <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0><b8_0>19th century<b8_0/><b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/> based on Finnish orthography. The <a3_0>Older Orthography<a3_0/> it replaced was created in the 17th century by Bengt Gottfried Forselius and Johann Hornung based on <a4_0>standard German orthography<a4_0/>. Earlier writing in Estonian had by and large used an ad hoc orthography based on Latin and Middle Low German orthography. Some influences of the standard German orthography — for example, writing 'W'/'w' instead of 'V'/'v' persisted well into the <b9_0>1930s<b9_0/>.
